_symbol_format: .TICKER YYMMDD P/C STRIKE  (positive qty = buy, negative = sell)
notes: SPY put calendar: short Mar 600P, long Apr 600P
rationale: Sell near-term theta, benefit from IV expansion in back month

entry_conditions.iv_environment: Enter when IV is LOW â€” calendar benefits from RISING IV after entry
entry_conditions.iv_rank_preferred: below 30 (cheap to enter, profits as IV expands)

sell_leg.strike: OTM â€” at a technical price target or support/resistance level

buy_leg.delta_range: same strike, same delta at entry

entry_conditions.notes: Monthly income playbook from PDF. Sell short-term OTM (20-35 delta, 1-3 months), buy same strike 1 month after short expiry. Theta positive, cheap, less volatile. Benefits from rising IV. Smaller gap between expirations = higher theta but more risk. Use technical levels (support/resistance) for strike selection. Neutral = ATM, bullish = OTM call, bearish = OTM put.

pnl_drivers.max_profit: Value of far-month option minus debit paid (at strike price at front-month expiry)
pnl_drivers.max_loss: Net debit paid (if stock moves far away from strike in either direction)
pnl_drivers.primary_driver: Theta differential â€” near-month decays faster than far-month. You pocket the difference.
pnl_drivers.secondary_driver: IV expansion â€” LONG VEGA position. Enter when IV is low, profit as IV rises after entry.

greeks_profile.theta: positive â€” near-month decays faster, you pocket the differential every day
greeks_profile.vega: POSITIVE â€” long volatility strategy, profits from IV increase
greeks_profile.delta: near neutral at entry (same strike, different months)
greeks_profile.gamma: slightly positive â€” near-month gamma is higher

pnl_drivers.backtest_reference: SPX 7/9 call calendar (OptionsKit): 82.1% win rate, 64% CAGR, every Wednesday at 3 PM. SPX 9/12 variant: 79.6% win rate, 50.8% CAGR.
pnl_drivers.ideal_scenario: Stock stays at strike through near-month expiry. Near-month expires worthless. Far-month retains significant time value + any IV expansion. Roll to next month.
